page.title: 09THORNE CHURCH
page.content: Thorne, tucked away in a lane that seems to have naturally born the name, can easily be observed from a stone seat in the churchyard and can be seen to mainly consist of old stone houses.The stables of a vanished priory have been converted recently into cottages.The small towerless church has been restored so leaving only the 13th. century door and lintelwork unchanged. It has an oak pulpit,carved chairs in the santuary,brass altar rails and a screen of oak.There is an urn shaped font of ornate masonwork from Ilchester Gaol. There is also a rectory garden from where, above the rectors roof, the Gaol bell can be seen.
